translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the One who Worshipped Well

analyzed: dussadāyaka tthera apadāna  tivara ayam pure ramme
translated: The Elder Dussadāyaka’s Birth Story
“In the past, in the delightful city of Tivarā,🔽I was the son of a king,
and after receiving a leaf-wrapper,
I was a peaceful servant.
The Fortunate One accepted it,
and touched the cloth with his hand;
After Siddhattha accepted it,🔽he rose up into the sky and flew through the air.
As the Buddha was flying along,
the cloth followed behind him;
I had confidence right there,
the Buddha is the foremost person.
For ninety-four aeons
I gave a cloth at that time;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving a cloth.
For seventy-seven aeons
I was a King who turned the Wheel,
called Parisuddha,
a powerful lord of men.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Dussadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā dussadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Dussadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā dussadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽dussadāyaka therassa apadānam aṭṭhama
translated: The Elder Dussadāyaka’s Birth Story, the eighth.
